Mystic Connection: Sporeling.name: Mystic Connection: Sporeling
Mystic Connection: Sporeling.description: When you hit another creature with a weapon attack, you infuse the attack with special spores that impose disadvantage on the target’s attack rolls until the end of their next turn. You can’t use this benefit again until you finish a short or long rest.

utility.condition: When you hit a acreature with a weapon attack.

Distracting Spores.name: Distracting Spores
Distracting Spores.description: You have disadvantage on all attack rolls until the end of your next turn.

Not in the Face.name: Not in the Face
Not in the Face.description: Your foes develop an overwhelming sympathy for you thanks to your telepathy powers. When a creature fails a saving throw against a power you manifest, you can momentarily flood the creature with conflicting emotions that prevent them from attacking you until the start of your next turn. Creatures that can't be &reference[charmed apply=false] are immune to this effect.

utility.condition: When a creature fails a saving throw against a power you manifest.

Not in the Face.name: Not in the Face
Not in the Face.description: You cannot attack the Talent until the start of their next turn.

Deathstrike.name: Deathstrike
Deathstrike.description:
When you hit an interdicted creature with a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to burn one of the seals on them to turn the hit into a critical hit. When you do, you also double the damage dice you roll for the burned seal.

You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

utility.condition: When you hit an interdicted creature with a melee weapon attack.

Exsanguinate.name: Exsanguinate
Exsanguinate.description: You can drain enemies to embolden your allies. Whenever you burn one or more seals on a creature who isn't a Construct or Undead, you can choose an ally you can see within 30 feet of you. That ally gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt by the seals to the interdicted creature.

Mystic Connection: Giant Spider.name: Mystic Connection: Giant Spider
Mystic Connection: Giant Spider.description: You gain a secondary sense that warns you of danger. You have advantage on initiative rolls, and you can’t be &reference[surprise]{Surprised} while you are not &reference[incapacitated apply=false].

Immolate.name: Immolate
Immolate.description: Channeling your pyrokinesis powers lets you set your enemies ablaze. Once per turn when you deal fire damage to a creature with a pyrokinesis power or your Flame On feature, you can make the target catch fire for 1 minute. While on fire, a target takes fire damage equal to twice your proficiency bonus at the start of each of their turns. At the end of each of their turns, a target can make a Dexterity saving throw against your talent power save DC, extinguishing the fire on themself on a success.

Immolate Creature.name: Immolate Creature
Immolate Creature.condition: When you deal fire damage to a creature with a pyrokinesis power or your Flame On feature.

Immolated.name: Immolated
Immolated.description:
You are on fire for the next minute, and take fire damage equal to twice the Talent's proficiency bonus at the start of each of your turns.

At the end of each of your turns, you can make a Dexterity saving throw against their talent power save DC, extinguishing the fire on yourself on a success.

Dark of Hell (8 Ferocity).name: Dark of Hell (8 Ferocity)
Dark of Hell (8 Ferocity).description: As an action, you cause your companion to radiate an aura of magical darkness in a 10-foot radius until the end of your next turn. You and your companion can see within this darkness, which moves with your companion.

Dark of Hell.name: Dark of Hell
Dark of Hell.description: You radiate an aura of magical darkness in a 10-foot radius until the end of your turn. You and your caregiver can both see through this darkness, which moves with you.

Telekinesis Adept.name: Telekinesis Adept
Telekinesis Adept.description:
When you roll a manifestation die to learn a new telekinesis power, you can roll the die twice and use either roll.

In addition, after you make a manifestation test to manifest a telekinesis power, you can reroll the manifestation die and use either roll. You can reroll a number of manifestation tests equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum one test), regaining all uses when you finish a long rest. You can use this feature only once for a single manifestation test.

Adept Telekinesis Manifestation.name: Adept Telekinesis Manifestation
Adept Telekinesis Manifestation.condition: After you make a manifestation test to manifest a telekinesis power.

Dynamic Power.name: Dynamic Power
Dynamic Power.description: When a Medium or smaller creature is hit by an attack roll for a power you manifest or fails a saving throw against a power you manifest, you can gain 2 strain to move the target up to 15 feet in any direction or knock them &reference[prone]. You can gain 3 strain to affect a Large creature with this Psionic Exertion option, or 4 strain to affect a Huge creature.

utility.condition: When a Medium or smaller creature is hit by an attack roll for a power you manifest or fails a saving throw against a power you manifest.

affects.special: A creature that is Medium or smaller.

Lava Geyser (8 Ferocity).name: Lava Geyser (8 Ferocity)
Lava Geyser (8 Ferocity).description:
As an action, you summon a powerful rush of lava centered on a point on the ground you can see within 30 feet of you. The lava fills a cylinder that is 10 feet tall with a 5-foot radius, and forces each creature in its area to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 4d6 fire damage and is knocked &reference[prone]. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. The lava then dissolves into fiery mist and fades away.

When you reach 17th level, the damage increases to 5d6.

Metamorph.name: Metamorph
Metamorph.description: Your brain allows you to alter a creature's body chemistry, letting you close wounds, grant superpowers, and even bring back the dead with a mere touch of the mind. Metamorphs are sometimes called changers, and those who make a formal study of the Metamorph specialization do so at the Academy of Body.

Poisonous Primal Strike.name: Poisonous Primal Strike
Poisonous Primal Strike.description:
Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 poison damage to the target.

Each time you gain a level in this class, you can change the damage type for this feature to another type from the list When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

damage.condition: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack.

Thunderous Primal Strike.name: Thunderous Primal Strike
Thunderous Primal Strike.description:
Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 thunder damage to the target.

Each time you gain a level in this class, you can change the damage type for this feature to another type from the list When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

damage.condition: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack.

Greater Telepathy.name: Greater Telepathy
Greater Telepathy.description:
You gain the ability to telepathically communicate at will. You can speak telepathically to any creature within 30 feet of you, which understands you whether or not the two of you share a common language. You can communicate even with creatures that have a low Intelligence or that understand no languages, and can speak telepathically in this way to one creature at a time.

Additionally, as an action, you can forge a telepathic link with other willing creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you, up to a total number of creatures equal to your Intelligence modifier. This link lasts for 1 hour. You and any of the targets can communicate telepathically with each other through the bond, whether or not you share a common language. Once this telepathic link is established, communication is possible over any distance, though it can't extend to other planes of existence. If you are &reference[incapacitated apply=false] or die, the telepathic link ends.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum once), regaining all uses when you finish a long rest. If you create a telepathic link with this feature while an existing link is already active, the first link ends.

Telepathic Link.name: Telepathic Link
Telepathic Link.description:
You have a telepathic link with up to five other creatures for the next hour. While this link is active, you and any of the other creatures you are linked to can communicate telepathically with each other through this bond, whether or not you share a common language.

Once this telepathic link is established, communication is possible over any distance, though it can't extend to other planes of existence. If the Talent is &reference[incapacitated apply=false] or dies, the telepathic link ends.

Bravado.name: Bravado
Bravado.description: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

Fury of the Wise.name: Fury of the Wise
Fury of the Wise.description: Also at 3rd level, your experience with your companion's rage awes those who dare stand against you. You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill if you do not already have it. Additionally, your Charisma (Intimidation) checks gain a bonus equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Fury of the Wise.name: Fury of the Wise
Fury of the Wise.description: You gain a bonus to Charisma (Intimidation) checks equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Pack Phalanx.name: Pack Phalanx
Pack Phalanx.description: At 3rd level, you and your companion learn to engage foes up close to keep them from harming those you protect. Whenever you and your companion are not &reference[incapacitated apply=false] and are both within 5 feet of a creature, that creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against any target that is not you or your companion.

Terrifying Power.name: Terrifying Power
Terrifying Power.description:
When a creature fails a saving throw against a power you manifest, you can activate this Psionic Exertion option. If the creature has a challenge rating equal to or lower than your talent level (or if its level is equal to or lower than your talent level, for creatures that don't have a challenge rating), you gain 3 strain and the target is &reference[frightened] of you for 1 minute. If the creature has a challenge rating or level higher than your talent level, you gain no strain and the target is unaffected.

Whenever a creature frightened in this way takes damage, they make a Wisdom saving throw against your talent power save DC, ending the condition on themself on a success.

utility.condition: When a creature fails a saving throw against a power you manifest.

Terrifying Power.name: Terrifying Power
Terrifying Power.description: You are &reference[frightened apply=false] of the Talent for one minute. Whenever you take damage while frightened in this way, you can make a Wisdom saving throw against the Talent's power save DC, ending this effect on yourself on a success.

Infernal Bond.name: Infernal Bond
Infernal Bond.description: You and your companion share a deep connection with each other … and with the Seven Cities of Hell! It might be that you work in the service of a devil, that you both spent time imprisoned in Hell before clawing your way out together, or simply that you bonded with a fiendish companion born in the Lower Planes. Whatever the case, you are connected to the Seven Cities and can use your companion's ferocity to unlock infernal magic.

Infernal Exploits.title: Infernal Exploits
Infernal Exploits.hint: You gain one infernal exploit of your choice. You gain an additional infernal exploit of your choice at 11th level. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the infernal exploits you know and replace it with another nature exploit, for which you must have the appropriate beastheart level.

Devil's Understanding: Infernal.title: Devil's Understanding: Infernal
Devil's Understanding: Infernal.hint: You can speak, write, and understand Infernal.

Devil's Understanding: Skill.title: Devil's Understanding: Skill
Devil's Understanding: Skill.hint: Additionally, you gain proficiency in the Arcana or Religion skill (your choice) if you do not already have proficiency in those skills.

Quick Hide (2 Ferocity).name: Quick Hide (2 Ferocity)
Quick Hide (2 Ferocity).description: You can activate this exploit whenever you take the Attack action. The first time you hit a creature with a weapon attack this turn, your companion can take the Hide action as a reaction if they are able to hide.

utility.condition: When you take the Attack action.

Intransigent.name: Intransigent
Intransigent.description: You and each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you are immune to the &reference[charmed apply=false] condition while you are conscious.

Intransigent.name: Intransigent
Intransigent.description: You and each creature of your choice within 10 feet of you are immune to the &reference[charmed apply=false] condition while you are conscious.

Dis's Onslaught.name: Dis's Onslaught
Dis's Onslaught.description: Each time you use a bonus action to place or move a seal, you can make one weapon attack as part of the same bonus action.

Invoke Hell: Embolden Allies.name: Invoke Hell: Embolden Allies
Invoke Hell: Embolden Allies.description: As a bonus action, you restore a total number of hit points equal to five times your illrigger level, divided however you choose between yourself and other creatures within 30 feet of you.

Sutekh's Blessing.name: Sutekh's Blessing
Sutekh's Blessing.description:
When Sutekh accepts you as his illrigger, he grants you access to his sacrilegious command of blood and life. You gain proficiency in the Religion skill.

In addition, as an action, you can expand your awareness of life around you. Until the end of your next turn, you can sense creatures who have blood within 120 feet of you without having to see them. This ability can penetrate most barriers, but is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt. You know the distance and direction of each creature, as well as the creature's type. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Sense Life.name: Sense Life
Sense Life.description: Until the end of your next turn, you can sense creatures who have blood within 120 feet of you without having to see them. This ability can penetrate most barriers, but is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt. You know the distance and direction of each creature, as well as the creature's type.

Keen Senses.name: Keen Senses
Keen Senses.description: At 14th level, your senses sharpen, becoming akin to those of a fearsome predator. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing, sight, or smell. Additionally, you can take the Search action as a bonus action.

Flash of Brimstone.name: Flash of Brimstone
Flash of Brimstone.description: When you place or move a seal, you can activate this boon (no action required) to magically teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of the target.

utility.condition: When you place or move a seal.

Quid Pro Quo.name: Quid Pro Quo
Quid Pro Quo.description:
You can whisper to the legions of Hell, ensnaring enemies and calling allies. As an action, you can attempt to banish a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target is banished to the wastes of Hell for 1 minute, after which they return to the unoccupied space nearest to the one they left. A target banished in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect early on a success. A creature who succeeds on a saving throw against this effect becomes immune to your Quid Pro Quo for 24 hours.

Additionally, when a target is banished in this way, a @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.actors.Actor.wBSRnPa2GE0uxeOd] (from MCDM's Flee, Mortals!) or a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.MADGs8pWMVyyFOf1] (from the core rules) appears in their place. This devil acts as an ally to you and follows your commands until the banished creature is no longer banished, at which time the devil disappears.

Once you successfully banish a creature in this way, you can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

Quid Pro Quo.name: Quid Pro Quo
Quid Pro Quo.description:
You have been banished to the wastes of Hell for the next minute. While banished in this way you repeat the saving throw at the end of each of your turns, ending the effect early on a success.

When this effect ends, you return to the unoccupied space nearest to the one you left.

Stinging Swarm (6 Ferocity).name: Stinging Swarm (6 Ferocity)
Stinging Swarm (6 Ferocity).description:
As an action, you conjure a swarm of stinging insects in a line that is 5 feet wide and 30 feet long. Each creature in the line except your companion must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 4d6 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The insects then dissolve to shadow and fade away.

When you reach 17th level, the damage increases to 5d6.

Lightning Eruption (8 Ferocity).name: Lightning Eruption (8 Ferocity)
Lightning Eruption (8 Ferocity).description:
When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 5d6 lightning damage and you can choose one other creature within 30 feet of the target that you can see. That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

When you reach 17th level, both instances of damage increase to 6d6.

Extra Damage on Hit.name: Extra Damage on Hit
Extra Damage on Hit.condition: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack.

affects.special: A creature within 30 feet of the original target.

Acidic Primal Strike.name: Acidic Primal Strike
Acidic Primal Strike.description:
Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 acid damage to the target.

Each time you gain a level in this class, you can change the damage type for this feature to another type from the list When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

damage.condition: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack.

Painkiller.name: Painkiller
Painkiller.description:
The heavily armored death troopers of Hell, Painkillers serve Dispater, leading from the front of every major infernal battle.

Dispater rules Dis, the City of War. When Hell invades another world, Dispater's army does the fighting and dying. His Painkillers are master strategists who lead from the front, inspiring terror and awe in their soldiers. The imperious Painkillers are full of pride and hubris, and they often obsess over their personal appearance.

Though among the most chivalrous of the illriggers, a Painkiller's gallantry is twisted. They accept and honor challenges to single combat, and swiftly punish any who try to interfere—but if losing, they don't hesitate to cheat, and if winning, they arrogantly toy with an enemy before finishing them.

In a moment of weakness or desperation, a ruler in another world might see their army facing certain defeat and call on Dispater. Ever eager to sow strife and discord, Dispater often responds to these pleas by sending a Painkiller to lead the desperate ruler's armies.

Precepts of Pride

Dispater's heavy shock troops must be effective battlefield commanders and quickly dispatch enemies. Painkillers follow precepts instructing them to lead Hell's armies and wage war against Good across the timescape.

Lead from the Front. I charge in at the front of every battle, inspiring my soldiers and terrifying my enemies.

Commander. Wherever I go, I command. I don't take orders from those who don't have the will to lead.

Victory at Any Cost. I respect the enemy leader and treat them honorably. But once swords are drawn, I use every trick in my arsenal to win, expecting them to do the same.

Soldiers Die. I care not for the lives of my soldiers, for they are resources I spend to secure my victory.

Dispater's Blessing.title: Dispater's Blessing
Dispater's Blessing.hint: When Dispater accepts you as his illrigger, you gain proficiency with heavy armor.

Blood Price.name: Blood Price
Blood Price.description: You can strengthen your defenses at the cost of your vitality. Whenever you fail a saving throw, you can spend one of your Hit Dice, rolling it and adding the number rolled to the result of the save.

Expend Hit Dice: D6.name: Expend Hit Dice: D6
Expend Hit Dice: D6.condition: When you fail a saving throw.

Expend Hit Dice: D8.name: Expend Hit Dice: D8
Expend Hit Dice: D8.condition: When you fail a saving throw.

Expend Hit Dice: D10.name: Expend Hit Dice: D10
Expend Hit Dice: D10.condition: When you fail a saving throw.

Expend Hit Dice: D12.name: Expend Hit Dice: D12
Expend Hit Dice: D12.condition: When you fail a saving throw.

Incontrovertible.name: Incontrovertible
Incontrovertible.description: Interdicted creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws.

Combat Mastery.name: Combat Mastery
Combat Mastery.description:
Your archdevil grants you uncanny skill in a certain form of combat. Choose one of the following illrigger combat masteries:

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.classes.Item.5DhsGwzumrgULn3D]{Bravado}

Bedevil.name: Bedevil
Bedevil.description: When you burn a seal on an interdicted creature, you can activate this boon (no action required). The target must subtract a number equal to your proficiency bonus from the result of the next saving throw they make before the end of their next turn.

utility.condition: When you burn a seal on an interdicted creature.

Invoke Hell: Enervating Spell.name: Invoke Hell: Enervating Spell
Invoke Hell: Enervating Spell.description: When you deal damage to a creature with an illrigger spell of 1st level or higher, you can expend a seal (no action required) and imbue the spell with weakening magic. The target has vulnerability to that spell's damage. If they normally have resistance or immunity to the spell's damage, that resistance or immunity is suppressed for this spell, and the target has vulnerability to the damage instead.

Nightmare Terrain.name: Nightmare Terrain
Nightmare Terrain.description: Terrain you shape with your mind is capable of harming your enemies. At the start of each of your turns while your Manipulate Terrain feature is active, you can select up to three creatures you can see in the area affected by that feature and shape the ground around them into attacking weapons (no action required). Each creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your talent power save DC or take bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (your choice) equal to your talent level.

affects.special: Creatures within the area of your Manipulate Terrain feature.

Hellish Wound (4 Ferocity).name: Hellish Wound (4 Ferocity)
Hellish Wound (4 Ferocity).description:
When your companion hits another creature other than a construct or an undead with their attack, you can have the attack deal a hellish wound to the creature (no action required). At the start of each of their turns, a target with a hellish wound loses 1d10 hit points for each hellish wound they have.

All of a target's hellish wounds close if they receive magical healing, or if any creature uses an action to staunch the wounds with a successful Wisdom (Medicine) check with a DC equal to your exploit save DC.

Foundry Note

Foundry does not support stacking active effects, but you are able to apply the active effect from the "Inflict Hellish Wound" activity on a creature multiple times. The "Hellish Wound Damage" activity can also be scaled to the amount of wounds a target has, deal the appropriate amount of damage.

Inflict Hellish Wound.name: Inflict Hellish Wound
Inflict Hellish Wound.condition: When your companion hits another creature other than a construct or undead with their attack.

Hellish Wound Damage.name: Hellish Wound Damage
Hellish Wound Damage.condition: At the start of a creature's turn.

Hellish Wound.name: Hellish Wound
Hellish Wound.description:
You have suffered a hellish wound, and lose [[/r 1d10]] hit points at the start of each of your turns for each hellish wound you have.

If you receive magical healing or a creature sues their action to staunch the wounds with a successful [[/check wis med]] check, all of your hellish wounds close.

Psionic Exertion.name: Psionic Exertion
Psionic Exertion.description:
You can expend your energy to give your powers an extra effect . You gain one of the following Psionic Exertion options of your choice. You gain additional options at 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

Master of Hell.name: Master of Hell
Master of Hell.description:
You learn to tear open a rift to Hell and wreak its fury on your enemies. As an action, you can summon a hellstorm centered on a point you can see within 150 feet of you . Choose one of the following effects, which fills a 50-foot-radius sphere centered on that point:

Inferno. Hellfire rains down on your foes. Each enemy in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d10 fire damage plus 5d10 necrotic damage, and they burn for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and does not burn. A creature burning in this way must repeat this saving throw at the end of their turn, taking 1d10 fire damage plus 1d10 necrotic damage on a failed save, or ending the effect on themself on a successful one. This hellfire can't be extinguished by nonmagical means

Pestilence. A foul miasma swirls around your foes . Each enemy in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d10 poison damage plus 5d10 necrotic damage and becomes &reference[poisoned] for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and does not become poisoned.

Darkness. A bitter storm assails your foes . Each enemy in that area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 10d10 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, the storm's gloom persists for 1 minute, and each enemy within that area is &reference[blinded] for the duration or until they leave the area.

Once you summon a hellstorm, you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

Burning Hellfire.name: Burning Hellfire
Burning Hellfire.description:
You are covered in magical hellfire. At the end of each of your turns, you must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking [[/damage 1d10 fire & 1d10 necrotic]] damage on a failed save, or ending this effect on a successful one.

This hellfire can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.

Mystic Connection: Mimic.name: Mystic Connection: Mimic
Mystic Connection: Mimic.description: As a bonus action, you touch a Small or smaller nonmagical object and polymorph it into any other nonmagical object of the same general size and weight, and whose value cannot exceed the value of the original object. The object remains polymorphed for 1 hour. If you move more than 30 feet away from the object, the polymorph ends early, or you can choose to end it early as an action. Using any material polymorphed in this way as a spell’s material component causes that spell to fail You can’t use this benefit again until you finish a short or long rest.

Mystic Connection: Giant Toad.name: Mystic Connection: Giant Toad
Mystic Connection: Giant Toad.description: You can hold your breath for 1 hour, and you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, you can make a long jump or a high jump as if you had a running start even when you don’t.

Mystic Connection: Giant Toad.name: Mystic Connection: Giant Toad
Mystic Connection: Giant Toad.description: You can hold your breath for 1 hour, and you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

Lies.name: Lies
Lies.description:
You can choose one type of melee weapon, such as a battleaxe, greatsword, or spear. When you attack with that type of weapon, you can use your Charisma modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls. You can choose a new weapon type, which replaces your previous choice, when you finish a long rest.

Foundry Note

You can use the Enchant activity on this feature to enchant any weapon of the chosen type, allowing you to utilize your Charisma modifier for attack and damage rolls with the enchanted weapons.

Combat Mastery: Lies.name: Combat Mastery: Lies
Combat Mastery: Lies.description: When you attack with this weapon, you can use your Charisma modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

Bloodstroke.description:
The magic that shields your allies now also saps their enemies' strength. When an ally who has temporary hit points from your Exsanguinate feature is hit by a melee attack, the attacker takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage (your choice) equal to your illrigger level.

Foundry Note

It is currently not possible to automatically apply the additional damage of this feature to creatures that have temporary hit points from the Exsanguinate feature. The damage activity on this feature can be used in place of this.

Diabolic Contract.name: Diabolic Contract
Diabolic Contract.description: You sign a diabolic contract with an archdevil who welcomes you into the Order of Desolation. Choose between the Architect of Ruin (Asmodeus), Hellspeaker (Moloch), Painkiller (Dispater), Sanguine Knight (Sutekh), or Shadowmaster (Belial) as your archdevil. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

Mystic Connection: Hellhound.name: Mystic Connection: Hellhound
Mystic Connection: Hellhound.description: As a bonus action, you shroud yourself in hellfire for 10 minutes. While you are shrouded in this way, any creature within 5 feet of that hits you with a melee attack or that touches you for the first time on a turn takes 2d6 fire damage. You can’t use this benefit again until you finish a long rest.

Hellfire Shroud Damage.name: Hellfire Shroud Damage
Hellfire Shroud Damage.condition: When a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack while you are shrouded in hellfire.

Hellfire Shroud.name: Hellfire Shroud
Hellfire Shroud.description: You are shrouded in hellfire for the next 10 minutes. While you are shrouded in this way, any creature within 5 feet of you that hits you with a melee attack or touches you for the first time on a turn takes [[/damage 2d6 fire]] damage.

Feral Reflexes (2 Ferocity).name: Feral Reflexes (2 Ferocity)
Feral Reflexes (2 Ferocity).description: When you or your companion is hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to increase the target's AC by 2 against the triggering attack.

utility.condition: When you or your companion is hit by an attack.

Haemal Exchange.name: Haemal Exchange
Haemal Exchange.description:
You have mastered the ability to enervate enemies and endow allies. When an interdicted creature within 60 feet of you makes an attack roll or saving throw, you can use your reaction to burn one of the seals on them and transfer their power. The target must roll a d8 and subtract the number rolled from the triggering attack roll or saving throw.

You then empower an ally within 30 feet of you. The next time that ally makes an attack roll or saving throw, they roll a d8 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

Haemal Exchange: Enemy.name: Haemal Exchange: Enemy
Haemal Exchange: Enemy.condition: When an interdicted creature within 60 feet of you makes an attack roll or saving throw.

Haemal Exchange.name: Haemal Exchange
Haemal Exchange.description: The next time you make an attack roll or saving throw, you roll a [[/r d8]] and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

Forked Tongue.name: Forked Tongue
Forked Tongue.description:
You can instinctively speak, read, and write Infernal.

In addition, you can speak two other languages of your choice, but you can't read or write them . When you finish a long rest, you can draw on your archdevil's knowledge to replace one of these two languages . When you do, choose another language whose name you know; you magically forget the previous language and gain this new one instead . Once you replace a language in this way, you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

Starting at 9th level, this feature grants you another language, for a total of three (in addition to Infernal) . Furthermore, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the intentions or sincerity of creatures.

Blood Sport (16 Ferocity).name: Blood Sport (16 Ferocity)
Blood Sport (16 Ferocity).description: When you hit a Large or smaller creature with a melee weapon attack, you can also push the target up to 30 feet away from you and knock them &reference[prone]. If the target ends this move within 5 feet of your companion, the companion can make a signature attack against the target (no action required). On a hit, the attack deals its normal effects, and the target is pushed up to 30 feet away from your companion. If the target ends this move within 5 feet of you, you can make a melee weapon attack against them (no action required) that deals an extra 4d6 damage if it hits.

utility.condition: When you hit a Large or smaller creature with a melee weapon attack.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
As an Architect of Ruin, you access a well of profane magic to cast spells. See “Spellcasting” in the core rules for the general rules of spellcasting.

Cantrips. You know two cantrips of your choice from the Architect of Ruin spell list (presented at the end of this subclass). You learn an additional cantrip from this list at 10th level.

Spell Slots. The Architect of Ruin Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your illrigger spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

For example, if you know the 1st-level spell @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.22dPoeXfaaAv4K3h] and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast hellish rebuke using either slot.

Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher. At 3rd level, you know three 1st-level spells of your choice from the Architect of Ruin spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Architect of Ruin Spellcasting table shows when you learn more illrigger spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. When you reach 7th level, for example, you learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the illrigger spells you know with another spell of your choice from the illrigger spell list. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Spellcasting Ability. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your spells, so you use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

Spellcasting Focus. You have an @UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.items.Item.bAArTRV7vMgOupR9], such as an amulet symbolizing your archdevil, a fragment of a blasphemous relic, or a glass orb holding a consecrated drop of archdevil blood. You can use the unholy symbol as a spellcasting focus for your illrigger spells. You must have a free hand to use the unholy symbol, but it can be the same hand you use to perform somatic components.

Infernal Teleport (4 Ferocity).name: Infernal Teleport (4 Ferocity)
Infernal Teleport (4 Ferocity).description: As an action, you or your companion (your choice) are surrounded by swirling shadow and smoke. The target teleports to an unoccupied space within 90 feet of their starting position.

Marked Prey (4 Ferocity).name: Marked Prey (4 Ferocity)
Marked Prey (4 Ferocity).description: When your companion uses a ferocity action that requires a creature to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the save.

utility.condition: When your companion uses a ferocity action that requires a creature to make a saving throw.

No Escape (1+ Ferocity).name: No Escape (1+ Ferocity)
No Escape (1+ Ferocity).description:
At the start of your turn when your companion gains ferocity and doesn't enter a rampage, you can spend up to your Wisdom modifier in ferocity (minimum 1; no action required). Until the start of your next turn, your speed or your companion's speed (your choice) increases by 5 feet × the ferocity spent.

Foundry Note

It is currently not possible to modify the bonus an active effect bestows based on scaling consumption. This feature has several different active effect able to be chosen, depending on the amount of ferocity expended.

utility.condition: When your companion gains ferocity and doesn't enter a rampage.

No Escape (1 Ferocity).name: No Escape (1 Ferocity)
No Escape (1 Ferocity).description: Until the start of your next turn, your movement speed is increased by 5 feet.

No Escape (2 Ferocity).name: No Escape (2 Ferocity)
No Escape (2 Ferocity).description: Until the start of your next turn, your movement speed is increased by 10 feet.

No Escape (3 Ferocity).name: No Escape (3 Ferocity)
No Escape (3 Ferocity).description: Until the start of your next turn, your movement speed is increased by 3 feet.

No Escape (4 Ferocity).name: No Escape (4 Ferocity)
No Escape (4 Ferocity).description: Until the start of your next turn, your movement speed is increased by 20 feet.

No Escape (5 Ferocity).name: No Escape (5 Ferocity)
No Escape (5 Ferocity).description: Until the start of your next turn, your movement speed is increased by 25 feet.

Primal Exploits.name: Primal Exploits
Primal Exploits.description:
Starting at 2nd level, you learn to channel your companion's fury into extraordinary deeds called primal exploits, which are fueled by your companion's ferocity.

You learn three primal exploits of your choice, and learn an additional two exploits of your choice when you reach 10th and 17th level. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can choose on of the primal exploits you know and replace it with another primal exploit, for which you must have the appropriate beastheart level.

Some exploits are activated using your reaction. Others are useable under specific circumstances but require no action. Some exploits are activated as part of the Attack action, in which case you can use only one such exploit per turn.

All exploits require you to spend your companion's ferocity to use them. Your companion must be within 60 feet of you when you use an exploit, and must have ferocity at least equal to the exploit's cost. The companion loses ferocity equal to the cost when you use the exploit. You can use an exploit even if your companion is &reference[unconscious apply=false], as long as they have the appropriate ferocity. You can't use an exploit while your companion has entered a rampage.

Some exploits allow a companion to make a signature attack. This signature attack can't be modified with additional exploits or used as part of a ferocity action.

Exploit Save DC

Some of your exploits require creatures to make a saving throw to resist the exploit's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

Exploit save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

Saving throws for your exploits use your exploit save DC even if the action that triggers the saving throw is undertaken by your companion.

Your exploit save DC also adjusts the DC of your companion's ferocity actions (see Superior Ferocity).

Energy Unleashed.name: Energy Unleashed
Energy Unleashed.description: When your powers tax you, you release some of that debilitating energy out into the world. Whenever you gain strain, you can choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your talent power save DC or take 1d6 psychic damage for each strain you gain.

Brimstone Teleport (8 Ferocity).name: Brimstone Teleport (8 Ferocity)
Brimstone Teleport (8 Ferocity).description:
As an action, you teleport to an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of you. Each creature within 5 feet of the space you leave and each creature within 5 feet of your destination space must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You and your companion take no damage from this effect.

When you reach 17th level, the damage increases to 5d6.

Summon the Wilds.name: Summon the Wilds
Summon the Wilds.description:
At 18th level, you can call forth nearby creatures as a distracting swarm. Depending on your location, this horde could consist of birds, fish, insects, rodents, or other similar creatures of your choice. As an action, you call out to the creatures, which arrive immediately and occupy a 30-foot cube centered on a point within 120 feet of you that you can see. The swarm persists for 1 minute. On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to move the swarm up to 30 feet in any direction.

Each creature of your choice that starts their turn in the swarm's area must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your exploit save DC or have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws, and a -5 to their passive Wisdom (Perception) score, until the start of their next turn.

You can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

Distracting Animal Horde.name: Distracting Animal Horde
Distracting Animal Horde.description: You have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws, and a -5 penalty to your passive Wisdom (Perception) score until the start of your next turn.

Nature Exploits.name: Nature Exploits
Nature Exploits.description:
At 3rd level, you gain one nature exploit of your choice, which functions in the same manner as your primal exploits and uses your exploit save DC as applicable. The exploit you choose must be one available at 3rd level.

You gain one additional nature exploit at 11th level. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the nature exploits you know and replace it with another nature exploit, for which you must have the appropriate beastheart level.

Architect of Ruin.name: Architect of Ruin
Architect of Ruin.description:
Architects of Ruin are cool and calculating arcane knights who serve Asmodeus, deploying spells, steel, and subterfuge to win at any cost.

Asmodeus rules Acheron, the City of Fear. His illriggers scour the timescape, collecting secrets and spells designed to deceive and terrify his opponents. The war he fights against the other archdevils is one of deception and information

His Architects of Ruin work to make Hell's enemies seem outnumbered and outmaneuvered. These illriggers are skillful spellblades on the battlefield, though some employ tactics such as research, infiltration, and propaganda to play mind games with their quarry. When an Architect of Ruin finally confronts an enemy, the advantage is theirs—they have studied, prepared, and gripped fate within their gauntlet, forcing it to favor them. They hungrily seek the dark arts to arm both themselves and Asmodeus with the impossible.

Precepts of Ruin

Architects of Ruin swear an oath to Asmodeus when they join the Order of Desolation. These precepts commit them to destroy Asmodeus's enemies by commanding great magic, causing fear, and sowing distrust.

The Battlefield of the Mind. By the time my armies meet yours, you'll be filled with terror and doubt your own strength . I won't have to lift a finger to defeat you.

The Proper Secret. Once I know your secrets, I know your weakness.

Knowledge Is Power. Lore is as powerful as steel. I learn every detail about my enemy and anticipate their every move, checkmating them before the game even begins.

Magic Is Mine to Command. Cunning is also as powerful as steel. I wield the dark arcane arts to manipulate your senses, weaken your resolve, and strengthen my blade. Your soldiers will quake for fear of what dark magics may next cloak my blade.

Architect of Ruin: Cantrips.title: Architect of Ruin: Cantrips
Architect of Ruin: Cantrips.hint: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the Architect of Ruin spell list. You learn an additional cantrip from this list at 10th level.

Furious Rampage.name: Furious Rampage
Furious Rampage.description:
At 11th level, your companion can channel their fury into stronger strikes. Whenever your companion hits one of your enemies with a signature attack during a rampage, the attack deals extra damage equal to the companion's ferocity (instead of half their ferocity).

Additionally, whenever your companion attacks a target within 5 feet of you while in a rampage, they make the attack with advantage. If you attack a creature within 5 feet of your companion when you use Frenzied Charge, you make your attack with advantage.

Hell's Charmer.name: Hell's Charmer
Hell's Charmer.description:
At 7th level, your companion can harness the super natural charm of devils to work enchantment magic on other creatures. As an action, choose one creature that can see you and your companion within 30 feet of you. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw, doing so with advantage if you or your allies are fighting them. On a success, the creature knows you tried to charm them and becomes hostile toward you and your companion.

On a failure, the creature is &reference[charmed] by you and your companion for 10 minutes, or until you or your allies do anything physically, mentally, or emotionally harmful to the creature. The charmed creature is friendly to you. When this effect ends, a charmed creature doesn't remember what happened during the time they were charmed.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum once). You regain all uses when you finish a long rest.

Hell's Charmer.name: Hell's Charmer
Hell's Charmer.description:
You have been &reference[charmed apply=false] for the next 10 minutes or until the beastheart or their allies do anything physically, mentally, or emotionally harmful to you.

When this effect ends, you do not remember what happened during the time you were charmed.

Sickening Strike (3 Ferocity).name: Sickening Strike (3 Ferocity)
Sickening Strike (3 Ferocity).description: You can activate this exploit whenever you take the Attack action. The first time you hit a creature with a weapon attack this turn, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be &reference[poisoned] until the start of your next turn.

save.condition: When you take the Attack action.

Sickening Strike.name: Sickening Strike
Sickening Strike.description: You are &reference[poisoned apply=false] until the start of the beastheart's next turn.

Infernal Flames (8 Ferocity).name: Infernal Flames (8 Ferocity)
Infernal Flames (8 Ferocity).description:
As an action, you cause a blast of fire to erupt from your companion. Each creature within 20 feet of the companion must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d10 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You and your companion take no damage from this effect.

When you reach 17th level, the damage increases to 5d10.

Freezing Strike (2 Ferocity).name: Freezing Strike (2 Ferocity)
Freezing Strike (2 Ferocity).description:
You can activate this exploit whenever you take the Attack action. The first time you hit a creature with a weapon attack this turn, the attack deals an extra 1d6 cold damage and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

The extra damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

damage.condition: When you take the Attack action.

Death Foiled.name: Death Foiled
Death Foiled.description:
By expending psionic energy, you return a dead creature to life. After spending 1 hour concentrating on and touching the remains of a creature that died within the last 8 hours, you gain 8 strain, and the creature returns to life with 1 hit point. Any poisons or diseases that affected the creature when they died are neutralized or cured when they return to life. This power closes all mortal wounds and restores any missing body parts.

Additionally, if you die and can gain 8 strain without surpassing your strain maximum, you gain 8 strain and your remains reform 1 hour after your death. When your remains reform, you return to life as above.

You can use this feature to return a creature to life (including yourself) once, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

affects.special: A creature that has died within the last eight hours.

Self-Resurrection.name: Self-Resurrection
Self-Resurrection.condition: When you die and you can gain 8 strain without surpassing your strain maximum.

Fiery Primal Strike.name: Fiery Primal Strike
Fiery Primal Strike.description:
Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 fire damage to the target.

Each time you gain a level in this class, you can change the damage type for this feature to another type from the list When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

damage.condition: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack.

Iron Gaol.name: Iron Gaol
Iron Gaol.description:
As an action, you can touch a creature and expend four seals to attempt to send that creature to Hell. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be pulled through a rift into the prisons of your archfiend's infernal city.

If the target is native to Hell, or if their level or challenge rating is 4 or lower, they remain there and must find their own way out. Otherwise, the target remains in the prison for 1 minute, after which they reappear in the space they left or in the nearest unoccupied space available; this target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect early on a success.

Iron Gaol.name: Iron Gaol
Iron Gaol.description:
You have been transported into the prison of an archdevil's infernal city for the next minute, after which you reappear in the space you left or in the nearest unoccupied space available.

You can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of your turns, ending this effect early on a success.

Primal Strike.name: Primal Strike
Primal Strike.description:
At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with primal energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 damage to the target. The damage type is determined by you when you gain this feature, and is chosen from the following list: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

Each time you gain a level in this class, you can change the damage type for this feature to another type from the list When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

Primal Warding.name: Primal Warding
Primal Warding.description:
At 7th level, you learn to use primal magic to set traps made of nearly invisible force. As an action, you trap a 10-foot-square area of ground centered on a point you can see within 30 feet of you, with the trap lasting for 8 hours or until it is triggered. When you set the trap, you can designate any number of specific creatures that are unaffected by it. Finding the trap requires a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your exploit save DC.

A creature that walks into the trap's area triggers the trap and must make a Constitution saving throw against your exploit save DC. On a failure, the creature takes 4d8 force damage and is &reference[blinded] for 1 minute. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded. A creature blinded by the trap can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on themself on a success.

A mental alarm alerts you with a ping in your mind if you are within 1 mile of the trap when it is triggered. This ping awakens you if you are sleeping. If you set more than one trap, you know which one was triggered.

You can use this feature to set a number of traps equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum one). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Asmodeus's Interdiction.name: Asmodeus's Interdiction
Asmodeus's Interdiction.description:
You learn the following additional interdict boons at the noted illrigger levels. Once you learn an interdict boon granted by this feature, you always know it, and it doesn't count against the number of interdict boons you know.

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.classes.Item.UeTnwMOHtNUWxAj8]{Axiomatic Seals} (7th Level; Passive)

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.classes.Item.va0L1fPTXJkkMdKu]{Spellbreaker} (13th Level)

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.classes.Item.fP96YvPZo29R0Q0f]{Hell Mage} (18th Level; Passive)

Psionic Evolution.name: Psionic Evolution
Psionic Evolution.description:
Any creature that benefits from your Psionic Toughness feature gains the following additional benefits for 1 hour:

  • The creature is immune to disease, poison damage, and the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition.

  • The creature's speed increases by 10 feet.

  • Once on each of the creature's turns when they deal damage to a target with an attack, power, or spell, they can deal extra psychic damage to the target equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1 damage).

utility.condition: When a creature gains the benefits of your Psionic Toughness feature.

Psionic Evolution.name: Psionic Evolution
Psionic Evolution.description:
While you benefit from the Psionic Toughness feature, you gain the following additional benefits for one hour:

  • You are immune to disease, poison damage, and the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition.

  • Your movement speed increases by 10 feet.

  • Once on each of your turns when you deal damage to a target with an attack, power, or spell, you can deal extra psychic damage equal to the Talent's Intelligence modifier (minimum 1 damage).

Chronopathy Adept.name: Chronopathy Adept
Chronopathy Adept.description:
When you roll a manifestation die to learn a new chronopathy power, you can roll the die twice and use either roll.

In addition, after you make a manifestation test to manifest a chronopathy power, you can reroll the manifestation die and use either roll. You can reroll a number of manifestation tests equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum one test), regaining all uses when you finish a long rest. You can use this feature only once for a single manifestation test.

Adept Chronopathy Manifestation.name: Adept Chronopathy Manifestation
Adept Chronopathy Manifestation.condition: After you make a manifestation test to manifest a chronopathy power.

Lissome.name: Lissome
Lissome.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend your movement to move 5 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

Mystic Connection: Giant Weasel.name: Mystic Connection: Giant Weasel
Mystic Connection: Giant Weasel.description: As a bonus action, you cause your teeth to become pointed weasel teeth for 1 minute, allowing you to make bite attacks against targets within 5 feet of you as a bonus action. This is a natural weapon attack that deals 1d10 piercing damage, and which can use your Strength or Dexterity modifier for its attack and damage rolls. You can’t use this benefit again until you finish a long rest.

Weasel-Teeth.name: Weasel-Teeth
Weasel-Teeth.description: Your teeth have become pointed like a weasel's for the next minute, allowing you to make bite attacks against targets within 5 feet of you as a bonus action. This is a natural weapon attack that deals 1d10 piercing damage, and which can use your Strength or Dexterity modifier for its attack and damage rolls.

Beastheart.name: Beastheart
Beastheart.description: A beastheart is an adventurer who forms a bond of friendship with a wild creature, and who draws power from that bond as it strengthens over time. Working as a team, a beastheart and their faithful companion can take on even the most dangerous adventures, challenging any monsters and overcoming any obstacles.

1Oqv4lEAiFRJ4YGF.hint: You gain proficiency with Strength and Wisdom saving throws.

gKWdMHxUYlZFMc8d.hint: You gain proficiency with light armor, medium armor, and shields.

MbTBzVMftotkVVNE.hint: You gain proficiency with simple weapons, battleaxes, greataxes, longbows, nets, scimitars, and shortswords.

Primal Exploits.title: Primal Exploits
Primal Exploits.hint: You learn three primal exploits of your choice, detailed below. You learn two additional exploits of your choice at 10th and 17th level. Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the primal exploits you know and replace it with another primal exploit, for which you must have the appropriate beastheart level.

Companion Bond.title: Companion Bond
Companion Bond.hint: At 3rd level, you choose a specialized bond that you share with your companion.  Choose Ferocious Bond, Hunter Bond, Infernal Bond, Primordial Bond, or Protector Bond. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

Master Caregiver: Animal Handling.title: Master Caregiver: Animal Handling
Master Caregiver: Animal Handling.hint: Also at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the Animal Handling skill. If you already have proficiency in Animal Handling, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with the skill.

Loyal to the End: Charmed & Frightened I.title: Loyal to the End: Charmed & Frightened Immunity
Loyal to the End: Charmed & Frightened I.hint: You and your companion can't be charmed or frightened.

Primal Exploit Damage Scaling.title: Primal Exploit Damage Scaling
Primal Exploit Damage Scaling.hint: Scaling Damage for Furious Vengeance & Crushing Charge

Mystic Connection.title: Mystic Connection
Mystic Connection.hint: Your connection to your companion grants a natural talent. The benefits of your Mystic Connection depends on your companion. If you ever gain a new companion, your new companion's Mystic Connection benefits replaces the old one.

Primal Strike Damage Type.title: Primal Strike Damage Type
Primal Strike Damage Type.hint: Choose the type of damage that your Primal Strike feature deals. Each time you gain a level in this class, you can change the damage type to a different one.

Heat Seeking.name: Heat Seeking
Heat Seeking.description:
Your psionic fires can seek and destroy your targets. Ranged attacks you make with the flames created by your Flame On feature have a range of 120 feet. All attacks you make with your Flame On feature ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

Additionally, the fire damage dealt by attacks made with your Flame On feature improves to 1d8 + your Intelligence modifier (minimum +1).

Belial's Interdiction.name: Belial's Interdiction
Belial's Interdiction.description:
You learn the following additional interdict boons at the noted illrigger levels. Once you learn an interdict boon granted by this feature, you always know it, and it doesn't count against the number of interdict boons you know.

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.classes.Item.o7opTXUe1pGL4vUP]{Veil of Lies} (7th Level)

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.classes.Item.dmpis7LQW0UJQbmY]{Hell's Assassin} (13th Level; Passive)

@UUID[Compendium.mcdm-class-bundle.classes.Item.oarmiAKO3kTMADJv]{Dark Malediction} (18th Level; Passive)

Hunter Bond.name: Hunter Bond
Hunter Bond.description: You and your companion share a love of the hunt. The pair of you are silent stalkers working together to take down prey of all sizes, whether to feed your friends or to destroy your enemies. Many beasthearts with this bond use ranged weapons to attack prey from afar while their companion closes in for the kill.

Hunter's Instinct: Survival.title: Hunter's Instinct: Survival
Hunter's Instinct: Survival.hint: You gain proficiency in the Survival skill if you do not already have it. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make using that skill.

Primal Pounce (3 Ferocity).name: Primal Pounce (3 Ferocity)
Primal Pounce (3 Ferocity).description: When your companion hits a creature with their signature attack, you can use your reaction to command the companion to grapple the target. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the companion grabs the target and the target is &reference[grappled] (escape DC equal to your exploit save DC). The grapple also ends if your companion attacks a creature other than the target.

save.condition: When your companion hits a creature with their signature attack.

Pyrokinetic.name: Pyrokinetic
Pyrokinetic.description: By interacting with the explosive energy found in all things, you can create and manipulate fire with your mind. To you, the flames you wield might be a beautiful work of art, a representation of your burning passion or rage, or simply a tool you use to do your job. Pyrokinetics are sometimes called burners, and those who take up the Pyrokinetic specialization do so at the Academy of Fire.

Manipulate Terrain.name: Manipulate Terrain
Manipulate Terrain.description:
You can shape the terrain around you, making it disadvantageous for your enemies by creating grasping hands, sentient vines, or other hindrances. As a bonus action, choose a point on the ground you can see within 60 feet of you. A 20-foot-square area centered on that point becomes &reference[difficultterrain] for creatures of your choice. The effect remains in the area for 1 minute, or until you use this feature again.

Once the area is established, you can use a bonus action each round to move the area up to 20 feet, or to move one willing creature you can see within the area to any unoccupied space within the area.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum once), regaining all uses when you finish a long rest.

Shadow Shroud.name: Shadow Shroud
Shadow Shroud.description: You can expend a seal as a bonus action to weave a mantle of semisolid shadows around yourself or a creature you touch. The target gains a +2 bonus to AC for 1 minute.

Shadow Shroud.name: Shadow Shroud
Shadow Shroud.description: A mantle of semisolid shadows is woven around you, granting you a +2 bonus to your Armor Class for the next minute.

Resopath.name: Resopath
Resopath.description: Through sheer force of will, you create and reshape objects and creatures, literally making your dreams and your enemies' nightmares come true. Resopaths are sometimes called makers, and those who enter the Resopath specialization do so at the Academy of Creation.

Conflagrant Channel.name: Conflagrant Channel
Conflagrant Channel.description: You can expend a seal as a bonus action to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Mystic Connection: Owlbear.name: Mystic Connection: Owlbear
Mystic Connection: Owlbear.description: As an action, you let loose an inspiring hoot. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you that can hear you gains temporary hit points equal to your character level. You can’t use this benefit again until you finish a long rest.

Fiendish Traits.name: Fiendish Traits
Fiendish Traits.description:
At 11th level, your companion's connection to Hell causes them to become more fiendish. Choose one of the following traits for your companion:

Barbed Hide. Your companion grows barbs all over their body. When a creature within 5 feet of your companion grapples them or hits them with a melee attack, that creature takes 1d10 piercing damage.

Fiendish Immunities. Your companion's skin, fur, or other coloring turns red, and the companion is immune to fire and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

Fiery Weapons. Your companion's natural weapons, such as teeth or claws, become sheathed in black fire. Whenever your companion hits with their signature attack, the attack deals an extra 1d6 fire damage.

Wings. Your companion sprouts leathery wings from their back and gains a flying speed of 40 feet. If your companion already has wings, those wings take on a fiendish look and their flying speed increases to 40 feet.

Whenever you finish a long rest, you can replace your companion's fiendish trait with another from this list

Foundry Note

This feature has a series of active effects that you can grant to your Companion. The "Fiery Weapons" enchant can also be used to enchant your Companion's signature attack to grant the bonus damage.

Fiendish Trait: Barbed Hide.name: Fiendish Trait: Barbed Hide
Fiendish Trait: Barbed Hide.description: Barbs grow all over your body. When a creature within 5 feet of you grapples you or hits you with a melee attack, that creature takes [[/damage 1d10 piercing]] damage.

Fiendish Trait: Fiendish Immunities.name: Fiendish Trait: Fiendish Immunities
Fiendish Trait: Fiendish Immunities.description: Your skin, fur, or other coloring turns red, and you are immune to fire and poison damage and to the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition.

Fiendish Trait: Wings.name: Fiendish Trait: Wings
Fiendish Trait: Wings.description: You sprout leathery wings from your back and gain a flying speed of 40 feet. If you already have wings, those wings take on a fiendish look and your flying speed increases to 40 feet.

Fiendish Trait: Fiery Weapons.name: Fiendish Trait: Fiery Weapons
Fiendish Trait: Fiery Weapons.description: Your natural weapons, such as teeth or claws, become sheathed in black fire. Whenever you hit with your signature attack, the attack deals an extra 1d6 fire damage.

Spirit Stampede.name: Spirit Stampede
Spirit Stampede.description:
At 11th level, when your companion enters a rampage, they summon the unseen spirits of dead creatures that run wild alongside them. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of your companion takes force damage equal to the companion's ferocity.

Foundry Note

This feature can be scaled to match your companion's ferocity, dealing the correct amount of damage.

damage.condition: When your companion enters a rampage.

Invigorated Rampage.name: Invigorated Rampage
Invigorated Rampage.description: At 15th level, you and your companion can channel your anger into overwhelming strikes. When your companion hits another creature with their signature attack while in a rampage, or if you hit another creature with the attack granted to you by Frenzied Charge, the target is either &reference[blinded], &reference[deafened], or &reference[frightened] of the attacker (your choice) until the end of the target's next turn.

Mystic Connection: Basilisk.name: Mystic Connection: Basilisk
Mystic Connection: Basilisk.description: As a bonus action, you cover your skin in a flexible layer of stone that lasts for 10 minutes. While coated in stone, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage You can’t use this benefit again until you finish a long rest.

Acheron's Chain.name: Acheron's Chain
Acheron's Chain.description: When you use a bonus action to place or move a seal on a Large or smaller creature, you can activate this boon (no action required). You conjure infernal chains to grasp the target, forcing them to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you can either pull the creature 10 feet toward you or cause them to be &reference[grappled] until the end of your next turn (escape DC equal to your interdict save DC).

save.condition: When you use a bonus action to place or move a seal on a Large or smaller creature.

Magnified Power.name: Magnified Power
Magnified Power.description:
After you make a manifestation test to manifest a power that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can gain 1 strain to double its duration, to a maximum of 24 hours.

Alternatively, after you make a manifestation test to manifest a power that has a range of 5 feet or greater, you can gain 1 strain to double the range of the power. After you make a manifestation test to manifest a power that has a range of touch, you can gain 1 strain to make the range of the power 30 feet.

Primal Understanding.name: Primal Understanding
Primal Understanding.description:
At 3rd level, you can speak, write, and understand Primordial and Sylvan.

Additionally, you gain proficiency in the Nature skill if you do not already have it.

Invoke Hell: Spellblade.name: Invoke Hell: Spellblade
Invoke Hell: Spellblade.description: You can use an action to both make a melee weapon attack and cast an illrigger spell you know that has a casting time of one action.

Expanded Power.name: Expanded Power
Expanded Power.description: After you make a manifestation test to manifest a power that creates an area of effect, you can gain strain equal to the power's order to double all dimensions of the area of effect.

utility.condition: After you make a manifestation test to manifest a power that creates an area of effect.

Beyond Instinct.title: Beyond Instinct
Beyond Instinct.hint: Your companion gains proficiency in saving throws with one ability score of your choice, and gains proficiency with one of the following skills of your choice.

Loyal to the End.title: Loyal to the End
Loyal to the End.hint: Your companion can't be charmed or frightened.

Devastator.name: Devastator
Devastator.description:
As an action, you invoke the authority of Dispater. You make a weapon attack and choose a number of willing creatures up to your proficiency bonus who you can see within 30 feet of you. Each creature you choose can use a reaction to make a weapon attack or cast a damage-dealing cantrip with a casting time of 1 action.

Once you use this action, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Chronopath.name: Chronopath
Chronopath.description: Your awakened mind manipulates the flow of time, making it simply another dimension that all things move through. Unlike you, most creatures go in one direction through time, but you can look and wander back and forth, slow it down, speed it up, or make it stand still. Chronopaths are sometimes called time masters, and those who follow the Chronopath specialization do so at the Academy of Time.

Dispater's Supremacy.name: Dispater's Supremacy
Dispater's Supremacy.description:
Your attacks against interdicted creatures score a critical hit on a roll of 18 through 20.

Foundry Note

You can enable the "Dispater's Supremacy" Active Effect on your character sheet to enable the expanded critical hit range when attacking an interdicted creature.

Dispater's Supremancy.name: Dispater's Supremancy
Dispater's Supremancy.description: Your attacks against interdicted creatures score a critical hit on a roll of 18 through 20.

Devil's Understanding.name: Devil's Understanding
Devil's Understanding.description:
Starting when you choose this bond at 3rd level, you can speak, write, and understand Infernal.

Additionally, you gain proficiency in the Arcana or Religion skill (your choice) if you do not already have proficiency in those skills.

Talent.name: Talent
Talent.description: The talent is a master of psionics—a source of incredible power created through sheer force of will. A talent can move and change matter, time, gravity, the laws of physics, or another creature's mind. In rare occurrences, a creature is born with the potential to harness psionic power. But only those who experience an awakening, an event that activates a talent's abilities, can tap into the mind's full strength.

Psionic Bastion.title: Psionic Bastion
Psionic Bastion.hint: You gain mastery over your mind and emotions. You can't be charmed or frightened, and magic or psionics can't put you to sleep.

Psionic Bastion: Psychic Resistance.title: Psionic Bastion: Psychic Resistance
Psionic Bastion: Psychic Resistance.hint: You have resistance to psychic damage.

Psychic Boost Uses.title: Psychic Boost Uses
Psychic Boost Uses.hint: The amount of times you are able to use your Psychic Boost feature before needing to complete a long rest.

Manifestation Die.title: Manifestation Die
Manifestation Die.hint: The size of your Manifestation Die.

1st Order Powers.title: 1st Order Powers
1st Order Powers.hint: At 1st level, you know four 1st-order powers. You learn an additional 1st-order power of your choice at 4th level, and another at 10th level. Manifesting 1st-order powers doesn't require a manifestation test.

ZzpHNvNvUMXxekUO.hint: You gain proficiency with light armor.

lvHIhrld5UvH4QVp.hint: You gain proficiency with clubs, daggers, light crossbows, quarterstaffs, slings, and spears.

em3tYVZIfmP29KFJ.hint: You gain proficiency with Constitution and Intelligence saving throws.

Psionic Exertion.title: Psionic Exertion
Psionic Exertion.hint: You can expend your energy to give your powers an extra effect . You gain one of the following Psionic Exertion options of your choice . You gain additional options at 7th, 11th, and 15th level. You can use only one Psionic Exertion option on a power when you manifest it.

UIjg4pS46akoHnbz.hint: You choose a psionic specialization based on the specialty that is the focus of your academy. Each specialization—Chronopath, Metamorph, Pyrokinetic, Resopath, Telekinetic, or Telepath—grants you unique features that reflect your training . Alternatively, if your character has eschewed the focused training of an academy, you can choose the Maverick specialization. Your choice of specialization grants you features when you choose it at 2nd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

Red Cant.name: Red Cant
Red Cant.description: When you make a Charisma check, you can expend a seal to treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

utility.condition: When you make a Charisma check.

Time Pocket.name: Time Pocket
Time Pocket.description: You temporarily remove a creature from space and time with your mind. As an action, you gain 3 strain and focus your mind on bending time around a creature you can see within 120 feet of you, which must make a Charisma saving throw against your talent power save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes 6d10 psychic damage and disappears, reappearing at the end of your turn 1d4 + 1 rounds later. The creature reappears in the space it previously occupied, or the nearest unoccupied space. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and their speed is halved until the end of their next turn.

Shunted into Time Pocket.name: Shunted into Time Pocket
Shunted into Time Pocket.description: You have been shunted into a pocket of time. You will reappear in the spot you previously occupied, or the nearest unoccupied space in 1d4 + 1 rounds.

Time Lag.name: Time Lag
Time Lag.description: Your movement speed is halved until the end of your next turn.

Frenzied Charge.name: Frenzied Charge
Frenzied Charge.description: Starting when you choose this bond at 3rd level, you learn to follow your companion's furious lead. Whenever your companion enters a rampage, you can use a reaction to move up to your speed and make a melee weapon attack against a target at the end of the movement.

utility.condition: When your companion enters a rampage.

Wicked Deception (3 Ferocity).name: Wicked Deception (3 Ferocity)
Wicked Deception (3 Ferocity).description:
As an action, choose a creature hostile to you that you can see within 30 feet of you. That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or suddenly view you and your companion as friends until the end of your next turn. While in this state, the creature is unable to attack or otherwise harm you or your companion.

This effect ends early if you or your companion attacks the affected creature. Creatures immune to the &reference[charmed apply=false] condition can't be affected by this exploit.

Wicked Deception.name: Wicked Deception
Wicked Deception.description:
You are unable to harm the beastheart or their companion until the end of their next turn.

This effect ends early if the beastheart or their companion attacks you. If you are immune to the &reference[charmed apply=false] condition, you are immune to this exploit as well.

Soul Eater.name: Soul Eater
Soul Eater.description: When you burn a seal on an interdicted creature, you can activate this boon (no action required) to gain temporary hit points equal to your illrigger level.

Invoke Hell: Grand Strategist.name: Invoke Hell: Grand Strategist
Invoke Hell: Grand Strategist.description: You can order your allies to follow your formation (no action required). Choose one or more creatures within 60 feet of you who can hear you, up to a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus. Each target can immediately move up to half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Infernal Majesty.name: Infernal Majesty
Infernal Majesty.description:
Your archdevil bestows on you the ability to don a measure of their power. As a bonus action, you channel the might of Hell, gaining the following benefits for 10 minutes:

  • You gain resistance to fire, cold, and necrotic damage.

  • Wings appear on your back, granting you a flight speed of 60 feet.

  • When you use your Blood Price, you can cause an enemy you can see within 10 feet of you to take damage equal to the number rolled on your Hit Die.

  • When you hit with a weapon attack, your Terrorizing Force deals an extra 2d8 damage instead of 1d8.

For the duration, if you die, you can choose to have your body disappear in a burst of flame, leaving behind only your equipment. If you do, your body reforms [[/r 1d6]] days later somewhere in Hell. Once your body reforms, you return to life and regain all of your hit points.

Once you channel your Infernal Majesty, you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

Infernal Majesty.name: Infernal Majesty
Infernal Majesty.description:
Your archdevil has bestowed you the ability to don a measure of their power, granting you the following benefits for the next minute:

  • You gain resistance to fire, cold, and necrotic damage.

  • Wings appear on your back, granting you a flight speed of 60 feet.

  • When you use your Blood Price, you can cause an enemy you can see within 10 feet of you to take damage equal to the number rolled on your Hit Die.

  • When you hit with a weapon attack, your Terrorizing Force deals an extra 2d8 damage instead of 1d8.

For the duration, if you die, you can choose to have your body disappear in a burst of flame, leaving behind only your equipment. If you do, your body reforms [[/r 1d6]] days later somewhere in Hell. Once your body reforms, you return to life and regain all of your hit points.

Bring Them Down (4 Ferocity).name: Bring Them Down (4 Ferocity)
